tags: None
review:
***** **** * ***** ******* It's been 3 years since the time we've been seeing her for my daughter.  She was only 2 months r so since then it's Dr.  Padmanjali who we are comfortable with. Her interaction with kids is simply superb and we've never had to probe her to know anything about the kid r the treatment r be it the vaccines. She briefs us simply superb.
How i wish she were present in the OT while my son was born but our bad that shes not allowed as per some hospital rules. I'd never want to change my kids paediatrician as she's been the best and wI'll remain. 
Both me n my husband are very happy with as all our concerns are addresses well and she never insists on medicines unless it's bad.
visit her to know her :-)

tags: None
review: Dr.Padmanjali listens to patient's problem patiently and explains everything right from cause of problem to proper way to take medicine etc.  in details.You can verify if you have any doubt.She is a very soft spoken person and we have always felt comfortable in consulting her for our son.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review:
We happened to choose Dr Padmanjali  as our regular Ped. was not available at the hospital.
After treatment and  follow up consultation of our 4 month old daughter, my wife and I choose to continue  with her as she connects well  and is  happy  answering questions regarding childcare .

tags: Doctor friendliness,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
Awesome doctor whom I met first time in bangalore .. very good screening.. and medicines they write are value for money.. antibiotic 13.00 Rs only .. I got shocked by looking at the price.
Good way to help patients when IT is going bad in India. Thank you

tags: Wait time,Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,
review:
To start with I had an appointment at 2:30 and the doctor only arrived by 2:50. CLoud nine should sync with the app and give appointments according to Dr availability. 
I was visiting because I wanted to be assured of my child's progress as we hadn't seen a doctor for almost 6months. My child of 3years is not comfortable with new people and so was on my lap during the consultation. The Dr asked my child her name she responded to this and a few other questions as well. The session was smooth until the Dr asked my child if she could put a stethoscope on my child to check her chest. My child is weary of strangers so at this point she cried and when the Dr went ahead my child made a hitting action. Of course I told my child that this behaviour was uncalled for. I think the Dr at this point got very angry because she started taking the conversation towards my child being autistic. Then she said "oh, but she is making eye contact... So maybe not autistic..." she asked me if my child had any difficulty in school because of her behaviour... I said that she had adjusted in school and the teachers in fact have told me that she does all her activities diligently. The Dr then suggested that maybe the teachers for their own convenience weren't telling me the truth about my daughters behavioural problems. They must be happy not to deal with a student and probably have their hands full with other students she said! Anyway that's the brief about my appointment with the Dr.
Pediatricians should have a broader span of patience and understanding. ** *** ***** ******** ** *** ***** **** *** ******* ** *********** ********* *** ****** ** * ******* ****** Do not tell a child that she has behavioural problems if she expresses a little anger. ** *** **** ** ****** ****** *** *** ******* *** *** ********* ** ********* Do not tell me that a child is not normal because she didn't say bye to you.
Anyway I am not going back to her. But I wanted to put my experience out there.

tags: Treatment satisfaction,
review:
*** ********** ***** ********* *** ** * **** *** *** *** *** ******** ** ****** *** **** ***** *** ******  * ***** ** *** ******* **** *** **** *** ******* *** ********. The medicine was mentioned on discharge summary with no dosage guidelines *** **** * ****** **** **** ** *** ******* ********** *** *** ****** *** ** ****** But when I asked for clarification regarding what alternate medicine should be given they told me to pay and get her consultation just to get this clarified.
Highly unprofessional. Would never recommend her.

tags: None
review: *** ** *** ** *** **** ****** * **** **** ******* * She is finest pediatrician. . Her advice has always kept my kids on better health ... every mum wants there child pediatric to be humble so tat kids don't get scared visting doctor.  She is very friendly and humble towards kids while treating them.. she communicates very well with the parents and it's assures us tat our kids r in safer hands. .

tags: Treatment satisfaction,Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,
review:
I have been going to Dr Padmanjali from 6 years...
Now I go even for my younger one ...prescribes the right n the most simple medications with no heavy dosages or antibiotics unnecessarily... very friendly and any health issue a single visit to her makes everything alright without needing a follow up visit...

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Wait time,
review: I visit her for both my kids. Her friendliness and level of attention is amazing. We have been visiting her for my second son since he was born in 2014, for his vaccination, ailments, emergency care and general health. So started taking my elder son also to her whenever he's sick. Both of my sons' are comfortable with her treatment and never get afraid like any other doctors we have visited when my elder son was infant.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Value for money,Treatment satisfaction,Explanation of the health issue,
review:
Always when I meet Dr whith my kid... we are always satisfied with her pleasing and friendly behavior... and we get confidence that our kid Will recover after meeting Dr... we are very happy with Dr Padmanjali. Thank you very much.
Regards
Ravichandran
Bhavani Ravichandran
Navya Ravichandran

tags: Doctor friendliness,Treatment satisfaction,Explanation of the health issue,
review: Friendly with children and guardians alike. No unnecessary medication on initial visit and waits for outcome of the prescribed medicine. We're regular visitors to her for both our children and we're extremely satisfied with her approach and treatment.

tags: Treatment satisfaction,Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,
review:
Seasoned,calm,composed and soft spoken doctor. Our son had rare Kawasaki disease which she diagnosed in time and treated it properly.
She is one of the doctors in whom you will develop trust as she knows well what she is doing and how important a kid life is.
Being a paediatric she is warm with little kids and responsive to all your queries and doubts.
She has a  positive attitude and right blend of qualities one would expect from a dignified doctor.
God bless her.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: Am new to the city, have just relocated from Gurgaon. Was super anxious to find a pediac as comforting as the one I was seeing there.  Visited the doc for a general consultation. Super doc- very patient, hears you out and comforts you. No unnecessary complications/medications.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review:
Dr.Padmanjali... hats off to her
Even v were scarred to visit a hospital for the first time with our daughter who was suffering from dengue ...
But in OPD... met this lady... really ... she is just a super cool... who doesn’t scare parents... explained us what exactly was happening to my 9 years old daughter...
Very graceful she was... my daughter was very happy tooo
... very sweet talk ... she was  following with ward sisters more than 3-4times at night... about my daughters condition. thank God... v were in right hands at cloud nine Jayanagar 
Thanks you very much !! Dr.Padmanjali!!

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
The doctor is very friendly and is receptive to all the problems that you put forth. She puts both the parents and the baby at ease before starting the process. She does not unnessarily prescribe drugs and is very reasonable with her advice.
However, the experience with the administrative staff at CloudNine was not very satisfactory. Although we had an appointment, we were made to wait to accommodate for walk-ins who had apparently 'arrived earlier'. The person coordinating the order in which patients are seen by the doctor seemed to be very confused and untrained at this

tags: Doctor friendliness,
review:
Doctor gives very relevant details. She is cheerful when she talks with the patients.

My discomfort is not with the doctor,but with the reception staff, who don't respond well. With 2 people sitting at the reception, one free and looking at her phone and the other attending to another customer, one would naturally go to the free staff, but the free staff redirects you to stand in line for the other staff to bill.
The pharmacy person is least bothered to provide with the medicines. He is too busy either chit chatting or doing something else when the customer is waiting.

tags: None

She listens to your problems patiently n then she will explain you the root cause.. Hard to find such doctors in a place like Bangalore..
